translation: Gaurasundar sings in a sweet voice:

text: “hare kṛṣṇa hare kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa kṛṣṇa hare hare hare rāma hare rāma rāma rāma hare hare”
gṛhe thāka, vane thāka sadā ‘hari’ bale’ ḍāka sukhe duḥkhe bhulo nāka

translation: Stay at home, or stay in a forest, regardless, always call out ‘Hari!’ In happiness and in sadness, don’t forget: chant the Lord’s Name aloud.

text: māyā-jāle baddha ha’ye āchha michhe kāja la’ye ekhan-o chetana peye
translation: Bound in Māyā’s net, you work in vain. Now, while you are still conscious, chant ‘Rādhā-Mādhava’.

text: jīvana ha-ila śeṣa nā bhajile hṛṣīkeśa
translation: Your life is ending, but you have not served Hṛṣīkeś. Bhakti Vinod advises: once relish His Name’s nectar.
